website_summaries.verdict: Though it isn't necessarily bad at anything, this GE LED isn't the best at anything either, and that makes it tough to recommend over flashier competitors.
pros: The GE Energy Smart 60W Replacement LED offers high efficiency lighting at a relatively low cost
Compared to the Cree LED, you'll notice a very slight uptick in color quality
cons: The GE LED is marginally less efficient than the competition, and it doesn't promise as long a lifespan, either

customer_reviews.title: Bulb burned out in 3 years
customer_reviews.text: I purchased on April 2015. I am replacing it October 2018. It should last longer than 3 years. I'm ordering a replacement to match the other two bulbs in my ceiling fan. Hopefully those last longer than 3 years.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Martin

customer_reviews.title: Not as "Blue "
customer_reviews.text: Hmm, what to say? It is less blue then older generation LED bulbs. It seems somewhat equavalent in colour temperature to a 3000k halogen rather then a 2700k icandescent. That being said, it's not the worst choice, but I feel that there are alternatives out there with even lower advertised colour temps, some are marketed as having 2400k light, that come closer to approximating the look of icandescent light.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Warnke

customer_reviews.title: RECEIVED AS SCHEDULES AND VERY WELL PACKAGED, HOWEVER IT ...
customer_reviews.text: RECEIVED AS SCHEDULES AND VERY WELL PACKAGED, HOWEVER IT IS ADVERTISED FOR USE IN ENCLOSED FIXTURES - BUT PACKAGE STATES "NOT FOR USE IN TOTALLY ENCLOSED FIXTURES"!
customer_reviews.author: dowopado

customer_reviews.title: It matched the other lamps I have in the room ...
customer_reviews.text: It matched the other lamps I have in the room. I find that is the hardest part of the new LED systems.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: It works well enough, but there's not as much ...
customer_reviews.text: It works well enough, but there's not as much difference between full brightness and dimmed to minimum level compared to other bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: jaamkie

customer_reviews.title: Bulbs are great, price, not so much
customer_reviews.text: I was happy with this purchase until I saw it (and bought it) at Walmart for $10.97. A Buyer Beware story - I should know better
customer_reviews.author: Mark H

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than a year.  Save your reciept
customer_reviews.text: Two of the four bulbs I bought are now starting to fail, turning off and on every 15 seconds or so, after they "warm up" Tapping on them brings them back to life for a short while which to me indicates design problems. Tapping on a solid state object should not have any effect at all. One bulb is an anomaly but two out of four is troubling. 22 years... Ya right
customer_reviews.author: Eric Jaakkola

customer_reviews.title: Nice Soft White Bulb
customer_reviews.text: This energy-saving LED bulb emits a nice soft white light. Although I would have preferred a full-spectrum light, these serve very well as reading lights or just to provide ambient light in a room after sunset. The intensity of the light is definitely comparable to standard incandescent light bulbs using 5 or 6 times the electric power. Because of time limitations, I cannot determine if the bulb will last the number of rated hours, but I plan to come back with an update after the bulb wears out.
customer_reviews.author: William L. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Excellent color and brightness
customer_reviews.text: I'm very impressed with this bulb's color and brightness. The size of the enclosure fits tight spaces in small lamps, and the glass distributes light pretty evenly (almost as well as a traditional incandescent bulb, though as you probably would imagine the opaque "collar" between the glass and screw mean that a little less light streams in the "downward" direction). For my uses there isn't any distinguishable difference, and I'll be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gitzlaff

customer_reviews.title: Bright, white LED bulb
customer_reviews.text: Like most LED bulbs, this GE bulb is heavy compared to an incandescent or CFL bulb, but it comes on nearly instantly and is as bright as its incandescent counterpart. Of course, it is much more energy efficient than incandescent. This bulb is a nice white compared to some other LEDs. It is also dimmable which is an advantage over some other LEDs. I'll never buy another CFL bulb, because they warm up slowly, seem to give off less light, and they often have a yellowish tint.
customer_reviews.author: C. Boudreau

customer_reviews.title: Great light.
customer_reviews.text: The light itself gives off a very bright and seemingly pure light. I am very pleased with it. I think the best compliment that I can give it, is that I don't notice that it is a LED light. I have it in my bathroom with other incandescent lights and I simply can only tell I have an LED light in there because I put it there. If I look directly at the light, then I can tell it is a different light. But it isn't a harsh or bad light. Very nice, I will buy more ....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yep its a light bulb
customer_reviews.text: A light bulb is one of the more difficult things to review in my opinion, if its working well what is there to say about it? Well, this light bulb is working well. The quality of the light it emits is at least as good as a CFL, it uses much less energy, and it comes on instantly. The real thing you want to know is-- how long will it last? That is something only time will tell. LED lights need to be kept cool to have a chance at a long life-- this makes them inappropriate for light fixtures that don't have good air circulation.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Goodchild

customer_reviews.title: Love the energy savings
customer_reviews.text: I have been interested in changing out my whole house from incandescent bulbs to LEDs. When a new one comes on the market I try it out. It's not always easy getting one for a dimmer, so I appreciated this one. I don't have a problem with it have certain tones, like more yellow or more white, because I just like the fact that I'm saving money using them. I hope they continue to last and last...
customer_reviews.author: Becs

customer_reviews.title: Great LED light bulb
customer_reviews.text: We have been gradually changing from CFL to LED bulbs as our CFL's have burnt out and have tried multiple different types and brands. We have ever had an LED light bulb burn out yet so they have all been good quality in that aspect. This bulb does provide a good pleasant light and with good coverage. It is probably the best LED we have tried so far, but the price is pretty steep.
customer_reviews.author: J. Plummer

customer_reviews.title: All pros, no cons
customer_reviews.text: Bought 9-10 of these from a local store, 2 started flickering and turning off after several months. I contacted GE today and they are sending 2 replacements, their customer service for warranty was essentially hassle free, awesome service. The 2 defective bulbs will not deter me from buying more GE LED bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: BZB

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced....Walmart has for $11
customer_reviews.text: This is an impressive bulb and I believe it puts out an honest 800 Lumens. It wastes about 3 watts in the power supply, but still uses about a third what a CFL bulb uses......plus no warm up and great cold weather performance. When I swapped these into service, and unlike the CFL bulbs, my wife never noticed. I bought mine at Walmart for $11....Amazon's price is currently too high. GE claims this bulb is dimable,, but I have not tried it in a dimable fixture yet..so look at other reviews if you plan to dim these.
customer_reviews.author: Red Rocks 2015

customer_reviews.title: Bright clean light, only lasted 5 weeks of daily use, poor engineering, poor construction.
customer_reviews.text: After 5 weeks of daily use, this lightbulb started randomly turning off. I thought there was a problem with a lamp, but switching lamps and the same effect began to happen. GE has gone down hill so much so in the last 20 years, I can't trust anything they make now that they regularly use inferior Chinese components
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I like that it's instantly on to full power unlike CFLs. The light color is a nice soft warm white. My only concern is about longevity. My experience with CFLs is that they don't last nearly as long as advertized. These being even more expensive you'll take even more of a financial hit but only time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Nick S.

customer_reviews.title: Warm isn't supposed to be *THAT* yellow
customer_reviews.text: I own omnidirectional "warm white" LED bulbs by a few companies and still have incandescent lights of the same color, so I have a general idea of what it should look like. Unfortunately, this particular GE bulb produced an extremely yellow light well beyond what someone might acclimate to after a while...so back to the store it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Trilkhai

customer_reviews.title: Works well; light is clear
customer_reviews.text: This says it will last 13 years. No way to gauge that yet:). I can say it works like a lightbulb should, and seems to be as bright or brighter than an incandescent 60 watt bulb. So far so good! Update 10/19/2015: Lasted less than two years with less than three hours use per day. I use it in a swag lamp over my bed while getting ready in the morning, and when I'm getting ready for bed and reading in bed. I also have a three-light ceiling fan that I use for most lighting.
customer_reviews.author: Cafali

customer_reviews.title: I got these stupid cheap at a big box store
customer_reviews.text: I got these stupid cheap at a big box store, my first GE led purchase, and they buzz/hum. Also they are hotter than the Phillips and Feit led bulbs I have (and they don't hum)
customer_reviews.author: wrightwinger

customer_reviews.title: Terrific color and brightness.
customer_reviews.text: I am quite impressed with this GE LED bulb. I installed them in our master bedroom and the light output is fantastic. The light is bright and of a strong white color. After using these, I am spoiled- standard bulbs look like an ugly yellow to me. LED bulbs are the wave of the future, and I can’t wait for prices to come down so that my entire home can be outfitted with GE LED bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Go Blue 99

customer_reviews.title: Not worth my time or money
customer_reviews.text: Makes an annoying buzzing sound just like a cheap CFL and gets very hot in an enclosed fixture just like an incandescent.
customer_reviews.author: Sosumido

customer_reviews.title: 10 yr life, Didn't last 10 months!
customer_reviews.text: Don't risk spending big bucks for something that may or may not work. Stick to the CFLs. You'll only use a few watts more PER hour. I calculate I'll save $7 over ten years with LED, assuming it lasts that long, but it didn't. You wanna help the environment? Turn out the lights when not in use!
customer_reviews.author: SN

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting bulb
customer_reviews.text: Provides a nice, even light. The major selling point is that this is a very long lasting bulb. So we will see how long it lasts, its has been doing good so far!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Fontenot

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Overall I'm happy with this. The color is close to an incandescent, though still you can tell the difference. It sure looks better though than some of the led lights I bought when they first came out. They were very blue and unflattering. 11 watts for the light of the 60 watt is great energy savings!
customer_reviews.author: Jay Bird

customer_reviews.title: Very yellow color + cannot be returned after opening
customer_reviews.text: The light is yellower than most incandescents, making it a poor match for what I was looking for. Why people like a very yellow hue in their home is beyond me. For the bad color, I was going to give this bulb a 3 out of 5 stars. However, GE also made the packaging in a way that this (very expensive!) LED light bulb cannot be returned after opening, so I'm removing 2 more stars because my money is unrecoverable. I'll think twice before I buy another GE product that cannot be returned after opening.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Takes too long to turn on
customer_reviews.text: Takes too long to turn on, when mixing with other types of bulbs this flicks on slightly later (probably only a few ms, but it puts me off). Returned and got the Philips 60w instead.
customer_reviews.author: J Nimmo

customer_reviews.title: I do not like these because...
customer_reviews.text: The light produced is good. The problem is that they were giving off a slight buzzing sound which many of the LED make. The bigger problem was when I reached up to screw it out by placing my hand on the white plastic part.... YEOOOWW !! So F#$%in HOTTT ! Totally ridiculous for an LED bulb to get hot like these do! I own LED bulbs from 3 other manufactures and they do not get this dangerously hot.
customer_reviews.author: Literary Vagabond

customer_reviews.title: No long life
customer_reviews.text: Save your payment receipts and the packaging bar code because out of three, two if mine have only lasted a month. Bet ge changes that five year warranty soon.
customer_reviews.author: dee

customer_reviews.title: Love LED.
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with LED bulbs. They light immediately, are bright and last forever. except for the high price they are perfect. Maybe as more are sold the price will come down. I hope so, then i will use them to replace all bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fine but not great
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine LED but it's not my favorite quality of light. Other brands have a better quality of color.
customer_reviews.author: Mido

product_meta.title: GE Lighting 89888 Energy Smart LED 11-watt (60-watt equivalent) 800-Lumen A19 Light Bulb with Standard Base, 1-Pack
product_meta.description: Style:11W=60W White| Size:Soft White (2700K)The future of lighting is here. Unlike standard incandescents, GE energy smart LED general purpose bulbs last up to 15,000 hours--more than a decade at 3 hours per day use and equal to 15 incandescents. They also use 75% less energy, making them a brilliant idea for your budget. And, GE energy smart LED bulbs provide soft white light instantly while fitting in many of the same fixtures as standard incandescent bulbs. Make the change to GE energy smart LED general purpose bulbs today.
feature_bullets: Lasts 13.7 years based on 3 hours per day usage
Dimmable; Long Life; Low Energy; 10-Year Warranty
2700K soft white light, 1 bulb per package

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.1 out of 5 stars52 ratings3.1 out of 5 stars
